register.description: Legacy identification on port p

bitfield.description: Legacy ID

register.description: Legacy identification on port p

bitfield.description: Legacy ID

register.description: Defines operation mode and data flow on port p

bitfield.description: Wake control

register.description: Defines operation mode and data flow on port p

bitfield.description: Wake control

register.description: This register is provided for legacy and possible future extension of protocol. Returns 0x1f.

bitfield.description: In the current implementation it must be always written 31, meaning the frame payload size is 32 bits.

register.description: This register is provided for legacy and possible future extension of protocol. Returns 0x1f.

bitfield.description: In the current implementation it must be always written 31, meaning the frame payload size is 32 bits.

register.description: Define the state of the transmitter on port p.

bitfield.description: State of the transmitter

register.description: Define the state of the transmitter on port p.

bitfield.description: State of the transmitter

register.description: Transmitter state for FIFO 0..7 Each bit gives the state of transmit FIFOs: 0x1: FIFO full 0x0: FIFO not full

bitfield.description: Each bit gives the state of transmit buffer register: 0x0: Buffer is not full. 0x1: Buffer is full.

register.description: Transmitter state for FIFO 0..7 Each bit gives the state of transmit FIFOs: 0x1: FIFO full 0x0: FIFO not full

bitfield.description: Each bit gives the state of transmit buffer register: 0x0: Buffer is not full. 0x1: Buffer is full.

register.description: Transmission bit rate divisor for port p

bitfield.description: This bit field B has a range [0..255] and it programs a division factor [1..256], B + 1. Example: Writing 0 divides by 1, writing 1 divides by 2, writing 2 divides by 3, etc.

register.description: Transmission bit rate divisor for port p

bitfield.description: This bit field B has a range [0..255] and it programs a division factor [1..256], B + 1. Example: Writing 0 divides by 1, writing 1 divides by 2, writing 2 divides by 3, etc.

register.description: Transmit break strobe register on port p

bitfield.description: Send a break signal on the port

register.description: Transmit break strobe register on port p

bitfield.description: Send a break signal on the port

register.description: Number of active channels on port p (this determines the number of the used channel descriptor bits on the MIPI port as well) It can be 1, 2, 4, 8, or 16.

bitfield.description: Number of active channels up to 16

bitenum.description: One logical channel used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 0.
Two logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 1.
Four logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 2.
Eight logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 3.
Sixteen logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 4.

register.description: Number of active channels on port p (this determines the number of the used channel descriptor bits on the MIPI port as well) It can be 1, 2, 4, 8, or 16.

bitfield.description: Number of active channels up to 16

bitenum.description: One logical channel used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 0.
Two logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 1.
Four logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 2.
Eight logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 3.
Sixteen logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 4.

register.description: Arbitration type for the transmit FIFOs on port p.
Arbitration type for the transmit FIFOs on port p.

Transmit register for FIFO 0..7 Important: Write access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen loads its value into the transmit FIFO. If using only 16- bit accesses, the lower 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16-bit FIFO-related access there cannot be any other FIFO-related OCP access.

bitfield.description: 32 bits of data

register.description: Transmit register for FIFO 0..7 Important: Write access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen loads its value into the transmit FIFO. If using only 16- bit accesses, the lower 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16-bit FIFO-related access there cannot be any other FIFO-related OCP access.

bitfield.description: 32 bits of data

register.description: Transmit register with byte swapping for FIFO 0..7 Important: Write access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen loads its value into the transmit FIFO. If using only 16-bit accesses, the upper 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16-bit FIFO-related access there cannot be any other FIFO-related OCP access.

bitfield.description: 32 bits of byte-swapped data

register.description: Transmit register with byte swapping for FIFO 0..7 Important: Write access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen loads its value into the transmit FIFO. If using only 16-bit accesses, the upper 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16-bit FIFO-related access there cannot be any other FIFO-related OCP access.

bitfield.description: 32 bits of byte-swapped data

register.description: TX FIFO configuration register. One register per FIFO.

bitfield.description: Number of empty TX FIFO locations that will activate interrupt or DMA requests.DMA requests (if enabled) or interrupt assertion (if enabled) is triggered if the number of free locations in FIFO is less than the THRESHOLD value. . … . 0x9 through 0xF: No request generated .

bitenum.description: Less than 8 words in the FIFO
Less than 1 words in the FIFO
Less than 2 words in the FIFO
Less than 8 words in the FIFO

bitfield.description: Associates the FIFO to a HSI port
Associates the TX FIFO to a HSI logical channel number (0-15):… .
Enables the FIFO

register.description: Number of active channels on port p (this determines the number of the used channel descriptor bits on the MIPI port as well) It can be 1, 2, 4, 8, or 16.

bitenum.description: One logical channel used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 0
Two logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 1
Four logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 2
Eight logical channels used, number of the channel descriptor bits is 3

register.description: Overrun detection state register for those receive FIFOs that are mapped to port p

bitfield.description: Bit n is set when overrun is detected on channel n

register.description: Overrun detection state register for those receive FIFOs that are mapped to port p

bitfield.description: Bit n is set when overrun is detected on channel n

register.description: Overrun acknowledge register for those receive FIFOs that are mapped to port p

bitfield.description: Bit n is set when overrun is acknowledged on channel n.

register.description: Overrun acknowledge register for those receive FIFOs that are mapped to port p

bitfield.description: Bit n is set when overrun is acknowledged on channel n.

register.description: Counters setting register for port p

bitfield.description: Setting for Frame Burst Counter. Setting n as a value results in n + 1 counter value.
Setting for Tailing Bit Counter. Setting n as a value results in n + 1 counter value.
Setting for Frame Time-out counter. Set n as a value results in n+1 counter value.

register.description: Counters setting register for port p

bitfield.description: Setting for Frame Burst Counter. Setting n as a value results in n + 1 counter value.
Setting for Tailing Bit Counter. Setting n as a value results in n + 1 counter value.
Setting for Frame Time-out counter. Set n as a value results in n+1 counter value.

register.description: Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7 Important: Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen removes the receive FIFO-related item. If using only 16-bit accesses, the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16-bit FIFO-related access there cannot be any other FIFO-related OCP access.

bitfield.description: Received data

register.description: Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7 Important: Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen removes the receive FIFO-related item. If using only 16-bit accesses, the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16-bit FIFO-related access there cannot be any other FIFO-related OCP access.

bitfield.description: Received data

register.description: Byte swapped receive register for receive FIFO 0..7 Important: Read access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen removes the receive FIFO-related item. If using only 16-bit accesses, the upper 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16-bit FIFO-related access there cannot be any other FIFO- related OCP access.

bitfield.description: Received data swapped

register.description: Byte swapped receive register for receive FIFO 0..7 Important: Read access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen removes the receive FIFO-related item. If using only 16-bit accesses, the upper 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16-bit FIFO-related access there cannot be any other FIFO- related OCP access.

bitfield.description: Received data swapped

register.description: RX FIFO Configuration register. One register per FIFO.

bitfield.description: Number of words available in the RX FIFO for reading
Associates the RX FIFO to a HSI port
Associates RX FIFO to a HSI logical channel 0x0: Logical channel number 0 0x1: Logical channel number 1 … 0xF: Logical channel number 15
Enables or disables RX FIFO

register.description: Receive bit rate divisor for port p. This must be set for correct protocol timing detection (tailing time-out, frame time-out).

bitfield.description: The functional clock source divided by this value is used as a clock base for the receive counters. Setting n as a value results in the n + 1 divisor value.

register.description: Receive bit rate divisor for port p. This must be set for correct protocol timing detection (tailing time-out, frame time-out).

bitfield.description: The functional clock source divided by this value is used as a clock base for the receive counters. Setting n as a value results in the n + 1 divisor value.
